title: How to withdraw cash against a bankers cheque - Quora

response.answer_text: A bankers cheque always an “ account payee not negotiable ” instrument so it can not paid cash. You can deposit this BC in your account and withdraw cash from your account through cheque or atm. Preferebally you should deposit in same bank which BC has been issued. If both banks are same then it will be deposited in your account immediately after transaction executed by bank.

1. Deposit the cheque into your account and withdraw cash. This may require a few days delay between steps, or may not.2. Take it to the bank it is drawn on and request payment. This is called "presentment" and is much less common. If you can present ID, they must legally pay you the cash but you may find a specific teller has never done a presentment.
